Class QueryContext

Encapsulates the context within which a query is performed against a Container. The context includes namespace mappings, variable bindings, and flags that indicate how the query result set should be determined and returned to the caller.

Inheritance
System.Object
QueryContext
Implements

System.Object.GetHashCode()

Namespace: Figaro
Assembly: Figaro.dll
Syntax
public sealed class QueryContext : IDisposable
Remarks

Multiple queries can be executed within the same QueryContext; however, QueryContext is not thread-safe, and can only be used by one thread at a time.

QueryContext objects are instantiated using CreateQueryContext().

The XQuery syntax permits expressions to refer to namespace prefixes, and to define them. The QueryContext class provides namespace management methods so that the caller may manage the namespace prefix to URI mapping outside of a query. By default the prefix dbxml is defined to be "http://www.sleepycat.com/2002/dbxml";.

The XQuery syntax also permits expressions to refer to externally defined variables. The QueryContext class provides methods that allow the caller to manage the externally-declared variable to value bindings.

View Source

BaseUri

Gets or sets the base URI used for relative paths in query expressions.

Declaration
public string BaseUri { get; set; }
Property Value
Type Description
System.String

The base URI for relative paths in a query expression.
Remarks

For example, a base URI of 'file:/// export/expression/', and a relative path of '../another/expression', resolves to 'file:/// export/another/expression'.

DefaultCollection

Gets or sets default collection for fn:collection().

Declaration
public string DefaultCollection { get; set; }
Property Value
Type Description
System.String

The default collection.
Remarks

The default collection is that which is used by fn:collection() without any arguments in an XQuery expression.

View Source

EvaluationType

Gets or sets the query evaluation type to "eager" or "lazy".

Declaration
public EvaluationType EvaluationType { get; set; }
Property Value
Type Description
EvaluationType

The query evaluation type.
Remarks

Eager evaluation means that the whole query is executed and its resultant values derived and stored in-memory before evaluation of the query is completed. Lazy evaluation means that minimal processing is performed before the query is completed, and the remaining processing is deferred until the result set is enumerated.

As each call to NextDocument() or NextValue() is called the next resultant value is determined.

See Also
XmlResults
EvaluationType
View Source

QueryTimeoutSeconds

Gets or sets the query timeout value.

Declaration
public uint QueryTimeoutSeconds { get; set; }
Property Value
Type Description
System.UInt32

The query timeout value.
Remarks

The query timeout that will cause a query using this QueryContext to terminate if the query time exceeds the timeout value. The execution of the query will throw a FigaroException with an exception code of OperationTimeout if the timeout occurs.

See Also
FigaroException
QueryContext

System.String

Type Name Description
System.String name

The name of the variable to look up.
Returns
Type Description
XmlResults

An XmlResults object.
Remarks

If there is no value binding then the function returns false and value is set to a null value (IsNull() returns true).

InterruptQuery()

Interrupts a running query that was started using this object.

Declaration
public void InterruptQuery()
Remarks

This call must be made in the context of another thread of control in the application. The query will terminate and throw an exception with code OperationInterrupted.

View Source

RemoveNamespace(String)

Remove the specified namespace.

Declaration
public void RemoveNamespace(string prefix)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.String prefix

The namespace prefix to look for.
Remarks

Removes the namespace prefix to URI mapping for the specified prefix. A call to this method with a prefix that has no existing mapping is ignored.

View Source

SetDebugListener(XmlDebugListener)

Allows the application to associate an XmlDebugListener with a query context in order to debug queries.

Declaration
public void SetDebugListener(XmlDebugListener listener)
Parameters
Type Name Description
XmlDebugListener listener

The debug listener to assign.
Remarks

In order to prepare a query that contains debugging information an XmlDebugListener must be set on the QueryContext used when the query is prepared.

A different XmlDebugListener object (or none) can subsequently be set for query evaluation.

View Source

SetVariableValue(String, XmlResults)

Creates an externally-declared XQuery variable by binding the specified XmlResults value, or sequence of values, to the specified variable name.

Declaration
public void SetVariableValue(string name, XmlResults value)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.String name

The name of the variable to bind. Within the XQuery query, the variable can be referenced using the normal $name syntax.
XmlResults value

A sequence of results to bind to the named variable.
Remarks

This method may be called at any time during the life of the application.

See Also
XmlResults
